mdRecord.dcterms:description: The summer colony of Grindstone Neck lies on a peninsula southwest of the village. In 1889 a group formed “The Gouldsboro Land Improvement Company” with the idea of creating a summer colony much like that of Bar Harbor. Many of the buildings on the neck were designed by Lindley Johnson, though the first few were designed by Wilson Eyre. The first lots were put up for sale in 1890, with deed stipulations requiring that cottages be built within a year. By 1891, Grindstone Neck had appeared like magic, and within two more years, the majority of the 40 or so cottages built on the neck over the last hundred years were completed. This cottage was purchased by Charles and Laura McCrea of Philadelphia. -- http://en.wikipedia.or/wiki/Winter_Harbor,_Maine [work]
